intro: Hesperomecon greeneana, commonly known as the Greene's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Hesperomecon greeneana is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
